title: Don't always wrap in invisible parentheses
body:
Don't wrap multiline asserts into bracers if one part fits into one line and another already in brackets.
 
        data = [{
            "a": "b",
            "a": "b",
            "a": "b",
            "a": "b",
            "a": "b",
            "a": "b",
            "a": "b",
            "a": "b",
        }]
        assert data == [{
            "a": "b",
            "a": "b",
            "a": "b",
            "a": "b",
            "a": "b",
            "a": "b",
            "a": "b",
            "a": "b",
        }]



after black

```
+        data = [
+            {
+                "a": "b",
+                "a": "b",
+                "a": "b",
+                "a": "b",
+                "a": "b",
+                "a": "b",
+                "a": "b",
+                "a": "b",
+            }
+        ]
+        assert (
+            data
+            == [
+                {
+                    "a": "b",
+                    "a": "b",
+                    "a": "b",
+                    "a": "b",
+                    "a": "b",
+                    "a": "b",
+                    "a": "b",
+                    "a": "b",
+                }
+            ]
+        )
```

Can't we have same formatting for asserts as we have for assignments?


        assert data == [
            {
                "a": "b",
                "a": "b",
                "a": "b",
                "a": "b",
                "a": "b",
                "a": "b",
                "a": "b",
                "a": "b",
            }
        ]
